t: God*pn stands in the divine assembly; he*ln pronounces judgment among the gods:
“How*ln long will you judge unjustly and*ln show partiality to the wicked? Selah*ig
Provide*ln justice for the needy and the fatherless; uphold*ln the rights of the oppressed and the destitute.
Rescue*ln the poor and needy; save*ln them from the power of the wicked.”
They*pn do not know or understand; they*ln wander in darkness. All*ln the foundations of the earth are shaken.
I*pn said, “You are gods; you*ln are all sons of the Most High.
However,*ln you will die like humans and*ln fall like any other ruler.”
Rise*pn up, God, judge the earth, for*ln all the nations belong to you.
